thread.title: Rangers introduce cotton candy hot dogs for playoffs
thread.title_full: Rangers introduce cotton candy hot dogs for playoffs

title: Rangers introduce cotton candy hot dogs for playoffs
text:
Posted: 4:51 p.m. Tuesday, Oct. 6, 2015 Rangers introduce cotton candy hot dogs for playoffs By Cox Media Group National Content Desk ARLINGTON — 
Can’t decide between a hot dog and cotton candy at the ballpark? Now you don’t have to, as you can have both together in a culinary creation that is quickly going viral. 
The Texas Rangers have unveiled new concession items for the team’s postseason run. The “Sweet Spot Cotton Candy Dog” is topped with cotton candy-infused mustard and a tuft of pink or blue cotton candy. The sweet and savory treat will sell for $10, according to Bleacher Report . Rangers introduce new concession-stand items for playoffs, including a cotton candy hot dog http://t.co/xuLF0BWneV pic.twitter.com/tOUgTVttwU — Bleacher Report (@BleacherReport) October 5, 2015 
The “Inside Out Hot Dog” is filled with macaroni and cheese or mashed potatoes, then topped with brisket, chili or shredded chicken. A pretzel roll comes on the side to sop up the messy treat. This is a pricey offering at $26. New @Rangers games: Hot dog w/mac & cheese or mashed potatoes, topped w/brisket, chili or shredded chicken pic.twitter.com/5U5f5sQhXf — Darren Rovell (@darrenrovell) October 5, 2015 
Globe Life Park will also offer up “One-Pound Top-N-Go Cheetos” which, as the name implies, is a bag of Cheetos topped with brisket, taco meat, or shredded chicken, garnished with vegetables and drizzled with nacho cheese or sour cream. How over-the-top can the @Rangers get when it comes to playoff food? read @sblaskovich http://t.co/AFVz30SzaQ pic.twitter.com/0i19NG8oX8 — David Duitch (@davidduitch) October 5, 2015 
For those with a sweet tooth beyond cotton candy, check out the “Elvis Jabberdog Brownie.” The 2-foot long creation is a brownie covered in a Rice Krispies crust, dipped in funnel cake batter and fried. New for @Rangers games: A 2-foot long brownie in Rice Krispies crust, dipped in funnel cake batter & fried pic.twitter.com/usiE9n9AEY
